commit_message:
Change assertTrue(isinstance()) by optimal assert

Some of tests use different method of assertTrue(isinstance(A, B)) or
assertEqual(type(A), B). The correct way is to use assertIsInstance(A,
B) provided by testtools.

Change-Id: I17efd64bf4031788f03cf46468b77d7072981620
Closes-bug: #1268480

commit_message:
Drop keystone ec2 config

We don't actually configure the Nova EC2 API via instack anymore.

Once we switch Heat templates to use Swift for polling we should be
able to switch off the EC2 API.

Change-Id: I57e8f2bf99570e0187773f8d6e1cfbac007760e4
Depends-On: If028c9d7764210363135c3e7cc16ae1fb897a77c

commit_message:
Moving rsyslog to librarian v2

This change moves the rsyslog module to librarian. This change also
updates the rsyslog module to v3.5.1 from our customized 1.1.4 version.
With the update, our usage of file resources to manage syslog
configuration files has also been updated to leverage the
rsyslog::snippet resource.

This change also cleans up the lint issues with the openstack::logging
class.

The previous version of this patch was reverted due to missed
configuration changes between how 1.1.4 managed rules and how 3.5.1
manages rules. The newer configurations use rulesets for the remote
rules and so the configuration file for the master's rsyslog needs to
target the remote ruleset for where to place remote files.

Partial blueprint: fuel-puppet-librarian

Change-Id: I345844d44545381f0d79b6113eb2dbcc515d77cb

commit_message:
Make the tests page useful

This commit attempts to fix the tests page and make it useful. The
first thing it does is to remove all the bar graphs. These were added
to try and show something visual on the page. But they didn't convey
any information to the user and instead confused people.

The second thing this does is change the grouping to be more logical.
Instead of grouping on the test classes (which was also incorrect and
making assumptions about the path depth) this groups by the top level
path which will be the package the tests were in. (ie like tempest,
manila_tempest, etc) This makes more sense and also future proofs the
dashboard for when non-tempest tests are in the subunit2sql db.

The third thing this patch does is to change the default sorting order
on the tables to put the highest failure percentage at the top. This
will mean that what most people are interested in will be at the top
of the list. The fourth aspect of this patch is to default the groups
to open instead of closed.

Change-Id: I4426ba951276ef5d9482d67d5dfca7cd3d46d800

commit_message:
Report openstack-specs changes to openstack-dev

We don't report openstack-specs changes anywhere at the moment, and
since its cross-project, openstack-dev seems appropriate to me. I did
a quick straw poll there and got positive reception to the idea.

Original change Iccd0445d573464c9af62d2ec13bc1abd79ee322d was
reverted since it missed the branches set up, this
change includes branches now.

Change-Id: I6024d713cdebcfc641dd1c6e11568ff70ef82e48

commit_message:
Basic validation for gerritbot/channels.yaml

Recently a change merged that had not branches line and gerritbot
refused to start again. This could have been avoided by validation of
the file.

Test some basic validation of the yaml file to avoid breakage.

Change-Id: I2dc4a28aeac07d3fc73d3954d8fbe8f2448334e5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/46/261046/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: print("Basic check of gerritbot/channels.yaml") REQUIRED_ENTRIES=["branches", "events", "projects"] VALID_EVENTS=["change-merged", "patchset-created", "x-vrif-minus-2"] for channel in gerrit_config: for entry in REQUIRED_ENTRIES: if entry not in gerrit_config[channel]: print(" Required entry '%s' not specified for channel '%s'" % (entry, channel)) errors = True elif not gerrit_config[channel][entry]: print(" Entry '%s' has no content for channel '%s'" % (entry, channel)) errors = True for event in gerrit_config[channel]['events']: if event not in VALID_EVENTS: print(" Event '%s' for channel '%s' is invalid" % (event, channel)) errors = True print("\nChecking that all channels in gerritbot are also in accessbot")
deleted_lines: print("Checking that all channels in gerritbot are also in accessbot")

commit_message:
Don't monitor Cinder Volume LVs for disk util.

The disk utilisation monitoring will monitor cinder volumes if they are
attached to an instance and you run the MaaS play again.

We need to avoid this by ensuring that the model of moniitored disks is
not 'VIRTUAL-DISK'.

Change-Id: I6600e0e3cf8949cde332c1139fe6c9e3b0fa85e8
Closes-Bug: #1524770

commit_message:
VMware: Add support for VVOL datastores

vCenter 6.0 added support for a new type of datastore called VVOL
datastore. A VVOL datastore represents a storage container which
is a logical grouping of virtual volumes in an array that supports
VVOL. A virtual disk in a VVOL datastore corresponds to a virtual
volume in the array. Since VVOL datastores are treated like VMFS
or NFS datastores by vCenter APIs, the changes in the VMDK driver
to support VVOL datastores are minimal.

This patch adds the following changes in the VMDK driver to support
VVOL datastores:

* Add VVOL datastore type to the list of allowed datastore types

* Skip VVOL datastore while creating a volume from a preallocated
glance image because it involves replacing the data file of a
temporary virtual disk with the downloaded preallocated image
which VVOL cannot support.

Implements: blueprint vmdk-vvol-support
Change-Id: I528e4caed616dfd9bd85c7de113024bea6709fc1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/45/258945/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @mock.patch.object(VMDK_DRIVER, '_select_datastore') @mock.patch.object(VMDK_DRIVER, 'volumeops') def test_get_temp_image_folder(self, vops, select_datastore): host = mock.sentinel.host resource_pool = mock.sentinel.rp summary = mock.Mock() ds_name = mock.sentinel.ds_name summary.name = ds_name select_datastore.return_value = (host, resource_pool, summary) dc = mock.sentinel.dc vops.get_dc.return_value = dc image_size = 2 * units.Gi ret = self._driver._get_temp_image_folder(image_size) self.assertEqual((dc, ds_name, vmdk.TMP_IMAGES_DATASTORE_FOLDER_PATH), ret) exp_req = {hub.DatastoreSelector.SIZE_BYTES: image_size, hub.DatastoreSelector.HARD_AFFINITY_DS_TYPE: {hub.DatastoreType.VMFS, hub.DatastoreType.NFS}} select_datastore.assert_called_once_with(exp_req) vops.create_datastore_folder.assert_called_once_with( ds_name, vmdk.TMP_IMAGES_DATASTORE_FOLDER_PATH, dc)

Replace deprecated LOG.warn with warning

LOG.warn is deprecated. It still used in a few places. This updates
those one to use the non-deprecated LOG.warning instead.

Partial-Bug:#1508442

commit_message:
Checking the existence of volume

After some fail or cinder-volume restart we want to try create/delete/resize
volume again. To make it more reliable volume drivers should check if backend
already created a volume. The LVM driver and some of the nfs drivers already
contain private _volume_not_present methods, so in this commit we rename these
and expose them as public check_volume_exists methods and add a similar method
for the RBD driver to check if a volume exists on the storage backend. This
commit also adds an ExistingVD for drivers that implement the check_volume_exists
method.

Partial-Implements: blueprint check-volume-exists
Change-Id: Ice8a14d626ed3d8e3790f95c3c5055ef4bacdb30

commit_message:
Add params to force delete error instance

When we create a instance,there is some reason make the instance error.
Then use "trove delete" can delete the instance,because the vm belong
the instance is not exist.So wo only able to delete the instance from
mysql,it's so troublesome.I add the param to delete the error instance
and release the quota.

Change-Id: I4a1cb3026bb2d9b489a127d3b32939d111f822bd

commit_message:
Use binary mode when reading files

ast module takes two possible sources: bytestrings with possible "# coding: XXX"
line, or decoded strings without it. This means for common processing
bytestrings should be used instead.

The change shouldn't affect the plugins since the string value access is done
via ast, not lines themselves. The universal line splitting is not required in
the open() call since .splitlines() does it by default.

The change allows bandit to run regardless of the LANG environment variable.

Closes-bug: 1516081
Change-Id: Iea57bf66ea9f13b42e0f4143fa3ede476e2e26d9

commit_message:
Change LOG.warn to LOG.warning

Python 3 deprecated the logger.warn method, see:
https://docs.python.org/3/library/logging.html#logging.warning
so we prefer to use warning to avoid DeprecationWarning.

Change-Id: Iafbe78cdcfac329d3795853fe8cc38e549279375
Closes-Bug: #1530742

commit_message:
Properly show missing data in aggregated runs api response

This commit updates the runs aggregator to fill in the timestamps in
the response for missing data. Previously we were manually resampling
the data but only where there was valid data. This commit adds empty
lists to the response object where there is no data. This should
enable the js to properly represent the missing the data on the graph.

Change-Id: I95e37859783dc5597f8f0fc5e4f5e9ec1443d4f3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-health refs/changes/67/256767/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import pandas as pd import base_aggregator as base class RunAggregator(base.BaseAggregator): projects = [] frames = [] for timestamp in self.runs: for project in self.runs[timestamp]: passes = 0 skips = 0 fails = 0 for runs in self.runs[timestamp][project]: passes += runs['pass'] fails += runs['fail'] skips += runs['skip'] if project not in aggregated_runs.keys(): aggregated_runs[project] = {} aggregated_runs[project][timestamp] = { 'pass': passes, 'fail': fails, 'skip': skips, } for project, d in aggregated_runs.iteritems(): projects.append(project) frame = pd.DataFrame.from_dict(d, orient='index') frame.index = pd.DatetimeIndex(frame.index) frames.append(frame) df = pd.concat(frames, keys=projects) df.resample(base.resample_matrix[datetime_resolution], how='sum') df.interpolate(method='time', limit=20) return None
deleted_lines: from base_aggregator import BaseAggregator class RunAggregator(BaseAggregator): for execution_datetime in self.runs: updated_datetime = \ self._update_datetime_to_fit_resolution(execution_datetime, datetime_resolution) self._build_aggregated_runs(execution_datetime, updated_datetime, aggregated_runs) return aggregated_runs

commit_message:
Add documentation for user inputs as HTTPS URLs

This commit updates the ilo document for accepting user
inputs in driver_info and instance_info as HTTPs URL.

Closes-bug: #1514096

Change-Id: I79f319b066ff9f41d12fb6cf35724bd3b095e8bf
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/71/242771/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: * HTTP(s) Based Deploy.HTTP(s) Based Deploy ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Refer to `HTTP(s) Based Deploy`_ for more information. * HTTP(s) Based Deploy.HTTP(s) Based Deploy ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Refer to `HTTP(s) Based Deploy`_ for more information. * HTTP(s) Based Deploy.HTTP(s) Based Deploy ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Refer to `HTTP(s) Based Deploy`_ for more information. HTTP(s) Based Deploy ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ The user input for the images given in ``driver_info`` like ``ilo_deploy_iso``, ``deploy_kernel`` and ``deploy_ramdisk`` and in ``instance_info`` like ``image_source``, ``kernel``, ``ramdisk`` and ``ilo_boot_iso`` could be given as HTTP(s) URLs also. The HTTP(s) web server can be configured in many ways. For apache web server, refer `here https://help.ubuntu.com/lts/serverguide/httpd.html`_. The web server could reside outside of teh conductor nodes, but the URL should be accessible to the conductor and the baremetal i.e. the baremetal, conductor and the web server should be in the same subnet.

added_lines: .. image:: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/openstack/smaug/master/doc/images/Smaug.png :alt: Smaug :align: center What is Smaug? ============== Smaug is an OpenStack project that provides a framework for Application Data Protection as a Service. It is named after the famous dragon from J.R.R. Tolkien's The "Hobbit", which was known to hoard and guard the treasures of the people. Mission & Scope =============== Formalize Application Data Protection and Disaster recovery in OpenStack (APIs, Services, Plugins ...) Be able to protect Any Resource in OpenStack(as well as their dependencies) Allow Diversity of vendor solutions, capabilities and implementations without compromising usability. Typical Use Case: 3-Tier Cloud App ================================== 3-Tier Cloud App Web/App/DB .. image:: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/openstack/smaug/master/doc/images/ 3-tirApp.png :alt: 3-Tier Cloud App :width: 600 :height: 455 :align: center In order to provide full Protection for this typical use case, we would have to protect many resources, which have some dependency between them. The following diagram demonstrates how this dependency looks, in the form of a tree: .. image:: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/openstack/smaug/master/doc/images/ resource_tree_architecture.png :alt: Resource Tree :width: 600 :height: 455 :align: center These resources can be divided into groups, each of which will be handled by a different plugin in Smaug: - Volume - VM - Network - Project - Images Main Concepts ============= Plugins and ActionSets ---------------------- Vendors develop and plug resource protection mechanisms that comply with Smaug's ActionSet interface. The basic action set compromises of the following actions: - **Protect** Typically, protect the given resource at a specific point in time (e.g. backup, snapshot ...) based on the user preferences. A protection transaction is created in the bank (e.g. all the metadata needed to restore this transaction - **Restore** Recover a protected resource given a transaction - **Enable** Mark the plan as active, for ongoing protected resources mechanism (e.g. Volume replication ...) will start the protection. - **Disable** Mark the plan as inactive, for ongoing protected resources mechanism (e.g. Volume replication ...) will stop the protection. - **Verify** Will Verify that the transaction and all the backup data is functional For each Action in the set there is a definition of Parameters Schema and Result Schema. Example ======= Let’s take the OpenStack::Cinder::Volume resource *Protect* action. One of the action parameters in the Parameters Schema will be "Consistency Level": .. code-block:: JSON "parameters_schema" : { "type": "object", "properties": { "consistency_level": { "title": "Consistency Level", "description": "The preferred consistency level", "type": "string", "oneOf": [202 { "format": "Crash" }, { "format": "OS" }, { "format": "Application" }, ] } } } Banks ----- Vendors provide plugins that comply with Smaug's Bank interface. The basic Bank operations are: - .. rubric:: Read :name: read - .. rubric:: Write :name: write - .. rubric:: Delete Object :name: delete-object - .. rubric:: Lock :name: lock - .. rubric:: List Directory :name: list-directory Banks are used for writing *checkpoints* and transaction *metadata* to them. Protection plugins can also chose to write the actual protected Data to the bank, as well as to any other location, from which they can later restore. High Level Architecture ======================= .. image:: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/openstack/smaug/master/doc/images/ high_level_architecture.png :alt: Solution Overview :width: 600 :height: 455 :align: center The system is built from independent services and a scalable *Workflow engine* that ties them together: Smaug API Service ================= These top-level north-bound APIs expose Application Data Protection services to the Smaug user. The purpose of the services is to maximize flexibility and accommodate for (hopefully) any kind of protection for any type of resource, whether it is a basic OpenStack resource (such as a VM, Volume, Image, etc.) or some ancillary resource within an application system that is not managed in OpenStack (such as a hardware device, an external database, etc.). Protection Plugin APIProtection Plugin API ------------------------------------------ This API enables the Smaug user to access the Protection Plugin catalog and do the following operations: - List available Options and Results schema per resource - List available plugins - List all actual resources that can be protected by a given Resource Plugin - List available Protection Plugins by a given Resource Type - List actual resources that can be protected (i.e. a plugin that can protect them exists in the system) - List dependencies of a given Resource Plugin (i.e. sub-resources) Plan API -------- This API enables the Smaug user to access the protection Plan registry and do the following operations: - Plan Plan Plan Plan CRUD - List Plans - Plan Protection Definition CRUD Bank API -------- This API enables the Smaug user to access the Bank registry and do the following operations: - Manage Transactions - List available Bank plugins - List all banks configured by a given Tenant - Bank CRUD - Bank Schema Operation API ------------- This API enables the Smaug user to manage protection Operations: - Execute Protect on a given Protection Plan - Execute Restore on a given Protection Plan - Execute Verify on a Protection Plan - Status on a given Operation ID Trigger API ----------- This API enables the Smaug user to manage protection plan Triggers: - Trigger CRUD Transaction API --------------- This API enables the Smaug user to access and manage protection Transactions and checkpoints stored in the banks: - List all Transactions given a Bank ID. - Show Information on a given a Transaction ID. Smaug Schedule Service ====================== This subsystem is responsible for scheduling and orchestrating the execution of *Protection Plans*. The implementation can be replaced by any other external solution. All actual Protection-related activities are managed via the Operation northbound APIs, in order to support: Record maintaining of all operations in the Smaug database (to drive Operation Status APIs) - Decoupling the implementation of the Scheduler from the implementation of the Protection Service Trigger Engine -------------- This sub-component of the Schedule Service is responsible for generating triggers to begin the execution of the Plan Orchestration. It can be done based on a Timer or an Event Collector - Open to implementation. In the first version of Smaug reference implementation, it will only provide time-based triggering. Scheduled Operation ------------------- The sub-component of the Schedule Service is responsible for holding the mapping between a Trigger and Operation(s). Smaug Protection Service ======================== This subsystem is responsible for handling the following tasks: - Operation Execution - Protection Plugin management - Bank Plugin management - Bank Transaction service WorkFlow Engine --------------- This pluggable component is responsible for executing and orchestrating the flow of the plan across all protection plugins, and using the registered protection definition. All metadata and transaction info is written to a **Vault** in the user's **Bank** account. Protection Plugin ----------------- These pluggable components implement protection for one or more resources. They are responsible for the following: - Verification flow - Restoration flow - Exposing Protection Parameters (**Options**) - Implementing the **ActionSet** - Writing **Metadata** and **Transaction** information to the **Bank** that is assigned to the **Plan** - Select a target data store to use for actual data protection Bank ----- This pluggable component implements a storage area that is assigned to a Protection Plan, and is accessible across clouds. It is used for holding: - Global metadata - Transaction history The **Protection Plugin** writes all transaction metadata into the **Bank**, but it can also chose to write the actual **Protected Data** there, or just a URI that references the actual data target, which the plugin knows how to read. Bank implements the **List** interface in order to support transaction and metadata queries by the user. The Protection Plan workflow engine will orchestrate and define in which path we store the data for each transaction and for each protection plugin. Communication and Meetings ========================== Smaug Launchpad Link：\ https://launchpad.net/smaug Smaug Code Review：\ https://review.openstack.org/#/q/smaug+status:open,n,z Smaug Code Repository：\ https://github.com/openstack/smaug Smaug daily IRC Channel: #openstack-smaug Smaug bi-weekly IRC Meeting on (even) Tuesday at 1400 UTC in #openstack-meeting at freenode:\ http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/#Smaug_Project_Meeting

commit_message:
Make class action calls use version manifest

This follows the object_backport_versions() change by also making the
class action calls pass a version manifest. This is done in a compatible
way by first trying the new method, and if unsupported, falling back
to the original method.

No tests are changed here specifically to demonstrate that they are
undisturbed by this change. Proper tests are next.

Change-Id: If9a158fbd345b56b26ebbe2a0733db55f4929ea1
(cherry picked from commit fa7b1afb924b3d863d37a9f617e55027382df933)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.versionedobjects refs/changes/66/260666/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: version_manifest = obj_tree_get_versions(cls.obj_name()) try: result = cls.indirection_api.object_class_action_versions( context, cls.obj_name(), fn.__name__, version_manifest, args, kwargs) except NotImplementedError: # FIXME(danms): Maybe start to warn here about deprecation? result = cls.indirection_api.object_class_action( context, cls.obj_name(), fn.__name__, cls.VERSION, args, kwargs) def object_class_action_versions(self, context, objname, objmethod, object_versions, args, kwargs): """Perform an action on a VersionedObject class. When indirection_api is set on a VersionedObject (to a class implementing this interface), classmethod calls on remotable_classmethod methods will cause this to be executed to actually make the desired call. This usually involves performing RPC. This differs from object_class_action() in that it is provided with object_versions, a manifest of client-side object versions for easier nested backports. The manifest is the result of calling obj_tree_get_versions(). NOTE: This was not in the initial spec for this interface, so the base class raises NotImplementedError if you don't implement it. For backports, this method will be tried first, and if unimplemented, will fall back to object_class_action(). New implementations should provide this method instead of object_class_action() :param context: The context within which to perform the action :param objname: The registry name of the object :param objmethod: The name of the action method to call :param object_versions: A dict of {objname: version} mappings :param args: The positional arguments to the action method :param kwargs: The keyword arguments to the action method :returns: The result of the action method, which may (or may not) be an instance of the implementing VersionedObject class. """ raise NotImplementedError('Multi-version class action not supported')
deleted_lines: result = cls.indirection_api.object_class_action( context, cls.obj_name(), fn.__name__, cls.VERSION, args, kwargs)

commit_message:
Enabling domain lookup for project set v3 command

Currently the domain option for `project set` attempts to set
a new domain that owns the project. This is actually an action
that is denied by keystone server. Instead, the domain option
should be used as a lookup, to find projects that exist in the
non-default domain.

Co-Authored-By: Steve Martinelli <stevemar@ca.ibm.com>

Closes-Bug: #1524456

Change-Id: I30a3812184fe262667e09baa106d2275c2cbb981

commit_message:
Update volume API default version from v1 to v2

Cinder has deprecated API version v1 since Juno release, and
there is a blueprint to remove v1 API support which is in progress.
We should default to v2 API when it's there.

Closes-Bug: 1467589
Change-Id: I83aef4c681cbe342c445f02436fcd40cf1222f23

commit_message:
WIP: change line charts to histograms

This commit switches the graph time on the home page for total jobs to
be a historical bar chart instead of the line graph we were using
before. This should be a bit more accurate in how it displays the data
as it will properly visualize the sample grouping we do and missing
data. While the line graph gives the illusion of continuity which is
misleading.

Change-Id: I1d25df122b24210302e0a35867622ab5cea32f8d

commit_message:
Ensure default arguments are not mutable

* add hacking check: no_mutable_default_args()
* remove the mutable default arguments "[]" or "{}" when the function
  is defined.

ref: http://docs.python-guide.org/en/latest/writing/gotchas/

Closes-Bug: #1530282
Change-Id: Ice6f7654211b73d7f8bc3ca0e4dfae3dca354397
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/sahara refs/changes/08/262208/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - [S360] Ensure default arguments are not mutable.

commit_message:
Update Juno SHA's to the final EOL SHA's

This patch sets the repository SHA's to those of the final EOL tags.

This patch also introduces a cap for oslo.utils to prevent further
tags meant for Kilo from interfering with Juno builds.

Change-Id: Iad5fa03ce7c717b630e09dcaf9bfb7ae6b1ed490

commit_message:
Correct code output on python3

Code on py3 was off by one line in most cases due to float division. Corrected
to use integer // in both version.

Change-Id: Ib3f2f1a468639ad537b4f837caf3921963159c7f
Closes-bug: 1530754

commit_message:
Hyper-V: refines the exceptions raised in the driver

The exceptions raised in the HyperVDriver are too generic.
This commit addresses this issue.

Partially Implements: blueprint add-os-win-library

Change-Id: I05f1fa21540dad36bb4b04c8eebe8cc0b8585c1f

commit_message:
Rally: get the correct IMAGE_NAME from cirros_img_url

Current the statement which retrieves IMAGE_NAME from
cirros_img_url is located in global place. So it's
done before loading the configuration file.

Closes-Bug: #1530075

Change-Id: Ida75010fd3bf2cb6286390736ecd56567340de74

commit_message:
remove python 2.6 trove classifier

OpenStack projects are no longer being tested under Python 2.6, so
remove the trove classifier implying that this project supports 2.6.

Closes-Bug:#1519510
Change-Id: I4207349597abc8d3d05d6d210d35f438534a5997

commit_message:
Document tripleo.sh

Add documentation on how to use tripleo.sh to tripleo-docs. I think just
an overview will be sufficient. I don't feel like we need to go
overboard here, the script is meant to be developer automation, and self
documenting since it's simple bash. No reason to reproduce the same
commands as documention itself.

Change-Id: I4cbd57a32575e1a442c56ebf825e58cf035e19db
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-docs refs/changes/27/230027/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: tripleo.sh ========== `tripleo.sh <http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/tripleo-common/tree/scripts/tripleo.sh>`_ is a script that can be used to help bootstrap development environments. It automates much of the steps in this documentation to help get setup faster. It's opinioned automation around other production tooling (`python-tripleoclient <http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/python-tripleoclient>`_ , etc). tripleo.sh is also used by tripleo-ci to test TripleO patches. Get tripleo.sh -------------- tripleo.sh is from the `tripleo-common <http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/tripleo-common>`_ project. git clone tripleo-common, and the script is under the scripts/ directory:: git clone https://git.openstack.org/openstack/tripleo-common tripleo-common/scripts/tripleo.sh --help Using tripleo.sh ---------------- Options ^^^^^^^ The help text shows what options are available, and the options are listed in corresponding order with how a TripleO deployment is done. Repository setup:: tripleo-common/scripts/tripleo.sh --repo-setup Installing the undercloud:: tripleo-common/scripts/tripleo.sh --undercloud Building overcloud images:: tripleo-common/scripts/tripleo.sh --overcloud-images Registering nodes:: tripleo-common/scripts/tripleo.sh --register-nodes Introspect nodes:: tripleo-common/scripts/tripleo.sh --introspect-nodes Create flavors:: tripleo-common/scripts/tripleo.sh --flavors Deploy overcloud:: tripleo-common/scripts/tripleo.sh --overcloud-deploy Alternatively, all of the above options can be execute at once with:: tripleo-common/scripts/tripleo.sh --all Environment variables ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ Certain values and assumptions can be changed via environment variables. See the `tripleo.sh <http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/tripleo-common/tree/scripts/tripleo.sh>`_ source code for details.

commit_message:
Fix hardcoded urls for selective SSL implementation

Remove hardcoded urls from modules. Also fix wrong url calls which could lead
to use http instead of https.

Closes-Bug: 1528222
related blueprint: selective-ssl

Change-Id: I28c437151699371f8e8a343aa1090d8e3a6de80f

Functional tests for security group rule

Add functional tests for the "security group rule" commands.

Partial-Bug: #1519512
Related-to: blueprint neutron-client
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient refs/changes/03/261103/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import uuid from functional.common import test class SecurityGroupRuleTests(test.TestCase): """Functional tests for security group rule. """ SECURITY_GROUP_NAME = uuid.uuid4().hex SECURITY_GROUP_RULE_ID = None NAME_FIELD = ['name'] ID_FIELD = ['id'] ID_HEADER = ['ID'] @classmethod def setUpClass(cls): # Create the security group to hold the rule. opts = cls.get_show_opts(cls.NAME_FIELD) raw_output = cls.openstack('security group create ' + cls.SECURITY_GROUP_NAME + opts) expected = cls.SECURITY_GROUP_NAME + '\n' cls.assertOutput(expected, raw_output) # Create the security group rule. opts = cls.get_show_opts(cls.ID_FIELD) raw_output = cls.openstack('security group rule create ' + cls.SECURITY_GROUP_NAME + ' --proto tcp --dst-port 80:80' + opts) cls.SECURITY_GROUP_RULE_ID = raw_output.strip('\n') @classmethod def tearDownClass(cls): raw_output = cls.openstack('security group rule delete ' + cls.SECURITY_GROUP_RULE_ID) cls.assertOutput('', raw_output) raw_output = cls.openstack('security group delete ' + cls.SECURITY_GROUP_NAME) cls.assertOutput('', raw_output) def test_security_group_rule_list(self): opts = self.get_list_opts(self.ID_HEADER) raw_output = self.openstack('security group rule list ' + self.SECURITY_GROUP_NAME + opts) self.assertIn(self.SECURITY_GROUP_RULE_ID, raw_output)

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-22 11:09:23.000000000', 'files': ['novaclient/tests/unit/v2/fakes.py', 'novaclient/tests/unit/v2/test_shell.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-novaclient/commit/9cd9adb38c7643db34af0eebc28462a36428732f', 'message': "Fixed test_shell which can't test microversions>=2.4

Method run_command() gets max and min API verisons
from FakeHTTPClient.get_versions(). That's why max version
which could be tested by run)command is 2.3 (because it's
hardcoded in get_versions()).

get_versions() should return max and min versions from

"}]
commit_message:
Fixed test_shell which can't test microversions>=2.4

Method run_command() gets max and min API verisons
from FakeHTTPClient.get_versions(). That's why max version
which could be tested by run)command is 2.3 (because it's
hardcoded in get_versions()).

get_versions() should return max and min versions from
novaclient.__init__.py

Closes-Bug: #1528527

Change-Id: I489c4714cacb345d3b45d5987113093c038cf151
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-novaclient refs/changes/45/260445/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Fix fernet padding for python 3
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-10-06 20:59:54.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/keystone/commit/57f624d005298bf63e5e172ec7b9d4cc28926ab9', 'message': "Fix fernet padding for python 3

In python 3 it's important to keep track of what variables are
strings vs bytes when dealing with inputs as strings calling
functions that deal with bytes, such as base64 functions and
crypto functions. I added a bunch of comments to track where
things are strings vs where they're bytes.

TokenFormatter.restore_padding takes a string and returns a string,
so it shouldn't be using binary '='.

token.provider.base64_encode should return a string, not bytes.

token.provider.random_urlsafe_str should return a string, not bytes.

Change-Id: I0723cd50bbb464c38c9efcf1888e39d14950997b
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-10-07 21:57:30.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/keystone/commit/4cc7afe26ff502c9aa1cb73027738cdf8d962230', 'message': "Fix fernet padding for python 3

commit_message:
Fix fernet padding for python 3

In python 3 it's important to keep track of what variables are
text (six.text_type) vs binary (six.binary_type) when dealing
with inputs as strings calling functions that deal with bytes,
such as base64 functions and crypto functions. I added
documentation to track where things are text vs where they're
binary.

TokenFormatter.restore_padding takes text and returns text,
so it shouldn't be using binary '='.

token.provider.base64_encode should return text, not bytes.

token.provider.random_urlsafe_str should return text, not bytes.

A few other byte/string usages were fixed.

The python unicode doc suggests that code should work with
unicode (six.text_type) internally and only switch to bytes
(six.binary_type) at the edges, so this change is a move in that
direction. See https://docs.python.org/3.5/howto/unicode.html .

bp python3

Change-Id: I0723cd50bbb464c38c9efcf1888e39d14950997b

commit_message:
Remove some useless configuration command

A symbolic link which is /etc/neutron/plugin.ini pointing to
/etc/neutron/plugins/ml2/ml2_conf.ini is told to create when
we install and configure the networking service in the
compute node.
But it's no need to be created, because there is no
'/etc/neutron/plugins/ml2/ml2_conf.ini' file and
the ML2 plug-in is installed in the controller node.
Thus we should remove this command and skip this step.
Backport: Liberty

Change-Id: I76feb15477ffd2d65cc8eb46c7472b6de830105f
Close-bug: #1525075
(cherry picked from commit 76e5f6859b1e99fffe39f917f253da0a5ac67912)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/65/263265/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: #. The Networking service initialization scripts expect a symbolic link ``/etc/neutron/plugin.ini`` pointing to the ML2 plug-in configuration file, ``/etc/neutron/plugins/ml2/ml2_conf.ini``. If this symbolic link does not exist, create it using the following command: .. code-block:: console # ln -s /etc/neutron/plugins/ml2/ml2_conf.ini /etc/neutron/plugin.ini

commit_message:
Add a default port and default host

Both of these can be empty/none so handle the case
when they are by setting them to reasonable defaults.

commit_message:
Change LOG.warn to LOG.warning

Python 3 deprecated the logger.warn method, see:
https://docs.python.org/3/library/logging.html#logging.warning
so we prefer to use warning to avoid DeprecationWarning.

Change-Id: Ic19e8cb8cc7c6211f716376e35f5d2d7c68464ef
Closes-Bug: 1530742

commit_message:
Python 3 deprecated the logger.warn method in favor of warning

According to https://docs.python.org/3/library/logging.html#logging.warning,
We prefer to use warning to avoid DeprecationWarning.

Change-Id: I5b318d94c995ed488fd1110cc3bfdef7c8d7a272

commit_message:
Change LOG.warn to LOG.warning

Python 3 deprecated the logger.warn method, see:
https://docs.python.org/3/library/logging.html#logging.warning
so we prefer to use warning to avoid DeprecationWarning.

Change-Id: I10460a02cec125fd8cd34f78e57746b7f55bb172
Closes-Bug: #1530742

commit_message:
[contributor] Rewrite git and git-review on Windows

Installing git and git-review is not prerequisites,
just "set up git and git-review" itself.
To simplify the document structure,
move Windows related contents to the proper section.

* Move "installing git" to "set up git"
* Remove curl and tar or 7-zip as prerequisites
  - they are not needed to install git-review with pip
* Change Python version 2.7 to 3

Change-Id: I1ba39feedb6529b6ba08cd06860393fd926bdaa5
Closes-Bug: #1511943
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/37/263237/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: If you use Windows to contribute to OpenStack, install the `Git for Windows <https://git-for-windows.github.io/>`_. In the subsequent procedures, run commands from the Git Bash console. .. note:: If you use Windows to contribute to OpenStack, install the `Python <https://docs.python.org/3/using/windows.html>`_ as prerequisites. As part of the Python installation, be sure to install setuptools and pip as instructed.
deleted_lines: Install Windows prerequisites ----------------------------- If you use Windows to contribute to OpenStack, install the following prerequisites: * `git <http://msysgit.github.io>`_ * `curl <http://curl.haxx.se/>`_ * `tar <http://gnuwin32.sourceforge.net/packages/gtar.htm>`_ or `7-zip <http://sourceforge.net/projects/sevenzip/?source=recommended>`_ * `Python 2.7 environment <http://docs.python-guide.org/en/latest/starting/install/win/>`_ .. note:: As part of the Python installation, be sure to install setuptools and pip as instructed. In the subsequent procedures, run commands from the gitbash command line. .. note:: If you installed Windows prerequisites, you have already installed git as well.

commit_message:
Wrong usage of "a/an"

Wrong usage of "a/an" in the messages:
"support passing an new option specifying"
"create an multinode test setup"
"attributes also becomes a issue"

Should be:
"support passing a new option specifying"
"create a multinode test setup"
"attributes also becomes an issue"

Totally 3 occurrences in heat-specs liberty base code.

Change-Id: I1384f92e7e198afb5367a2f3d2f23b1da2b5812f

commit_message:
Convert to named volumes instead of data container

This intentionally leaves out rabbitmq from this patchset. It will
require additional work to remove its data container

UpgradeImpact
Partially-Implements: blueprint docker-named-volumes

Change-Id: Id68b8e43a3c077ef4f4f4d67ea34d0692e66eef7

commit_message:
Trival: Remove 'MANIFEST.in'

Everything in this file is automatically generated by pbr. There
appears to be no good reason to keep it around.
More details please see:
https://github.com/openstack-dev/pbr/blob/master/pbr/packaging.py#L384

Change-Id: Id9441479547b1907e8c027436544509c35ad6e95

commit_message:
use keystoneclient exceptions instead of oslo-incubator code

depending on any oslo-incubator code from another project is
dangerous. keystoneclient makes its exceptions public and it's
not recommended to use any code from
keystoneclient.openstack.common.apiclient since it's maintained
by oslo-incubator.

Change-Id: I40005893926d3c9e63e0e25fbc8a1dfaa7df80c2

commit_message:
Add 'use_standard_locale' parameter to execute()

Add 'use_standard_locale' parameter to execute() function.
It defaults to False. If set to True, execute the command
with standard (C) locale added to the environment variables.

Change-Id: I38d0c5feec3f201a0b2775f4df0d1813dfa03d84
Closes-Bug: #1514584
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.concurrency refs/changes/26/243326/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_with_standard_locale_false(self): out, err = processutils.execute('/usr/bin/env', use_standard_locale=False) self.assertNotIn('LC_ALL=C', out) def test_with_standard_locale_true(self): out, err = processutils.execute('/usr/bin/env', use_standard_locale=True) self.assertIn('LC_ALL=C', out) def test_with_standard_locale_env_variables(self): env_vars = {'SUPER_UNIQUE_VAR': 'The answer is 42'} out, err = processutils.execute('/usr/bin/env', env_variables=env_vars, use_standard_locale=True) self.assertIsInstance(out, str) self.assertIsInstance(err, str) self.assertIn('SUPER_UNIQUE_VAR=The answer is 42', out) self.assertIn('LC_ALL=C', out)

commit_message:
doc: contextual/plural translation requires oslo.i18n >=2.1.0

We introduced contextual/plural translation in version 2.1.0,
so declare this in documentation to avoid AttributeError.

Change-Id: Iadc24d19e2a2b799a5009a806ee7c64867b1d554
Related-Bug: #1525992
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.i18n refs/changes/72/260872/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. note:: These two functions were only available in oslo.i18n >= 2.1.0.

commit_message:
Change localhost to ip for ssh cred check

Attempts to ssh from ostf container to localhost failed,
so  we need to use ip here.

Change-Id: I22c6c805467f6c7a3486ed34b186bc33edbd4276
Closes-Bug: #1529667

commit_message:
Change localhost to ip for ssh cred check

Attempts to ssh from ostf container to localhost failed,
so  we need to use ip here.

Change-Id: I22c6c805467f6c7a3486ed34b186bc33edbd4276
Closes-Bug: #1529667

also we should switch 'haproxy_backend_status' to 'http' provider.

We calculate 'external_lb' during 'globals.pp' task - if we have
no VIPs with 'haproxy' namespace, then it's set to 'true'.

It does not change the default deployment scheme.

Also fixing minor issue with default provider for
'haproxy_backend_status' type.

commit_message:
Add support for external load-balancers

Add new hiera configuration key 'external_lb'. If it's set to
true then we should not configure Haproxy LB on controllers and
also we should switch 'haproxy_backend_status' to 'http' provider.

We calculate 'external_lb' during 'globals.pp' task - if we have
no VIPs with 'haproxy' namespace, then it's set to 'true'.

It does not change the default deployment scheme.

Also fixing minor issue with default provider for
'haproxy_backend_status' type.

Closes-bug: #1522749
Change-Id: I5539d04d577465bd410494a6c0b7caff18857878
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/25/260125/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: $external_lb = hiera('external_lb', false) if ($use_swift and !$external_lb) {

commit_message:
Remove meaningless default value in __get__()

In function object.__get__(self, instance, owner), owner is always
the owner class, while instance is the instance that the attribute
was accessed through, or None when the attribute is accessed through
the owner. Setting owner default value makes no sense.
refer to:
http://python-reference.readthedocs.org/en/latest/docs/dunderdsc/get.html#get

Change-Id: I74c2105f3100711b62171db65bc0656393adf2b8

commit_message:
Change LOG.warn to LOG.warning

Python 3 deprecated the logger.warn method, see:
https://docs.python.org/3/library/logging.html#logging.warning
so we prefer to use warning to avoid DeprecationWarning.

Change-Id: I2d71a52f6c86bc2def2c3abd0750236a86ccc6cf
Closes-Bug: #1530742

commit_message:
Install nanomsg for pub-sub module

We seperate between the DB and the pub-sub mechanism in
Dragonflow in order to allow better optimizations and
support optimized publish-subscribe for DB's that dont support
it.
This installs nanomsg which will be used as the default pub-sub
for Dragonflow

Change-Id: I861471c99e626b8c20f2a5fbefbf06581b181c7b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/dragonflow refs/changes/53/261753/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: function install_nanomsg { local _pwd=$(pwd) if [ ! -f "$DEST/nanomsg" ]; then mkdir $DEST/nanomsg wget https://github.com/nanomsg/nanomsg/releases/download/0.8-beta/nanomsg-0.8-beta.tar.gz -O $DEST/nanomsg/nanomsg-0.8-beta.tar.gz tar xzvf $DEST/nanomsg/nanomsg-0.8-beta.tar.gz -C $DEST/nanomsg cd $DEST/nanomsg/nanomsg-0.8-beta/ ./configure make sudo make install if [ -f "/usr/local/lib/libnanomsg.so" ]; then sudo cp /usr/local/lib/libnanomsg.so /usr/lib/. fi sudo pip install -I git+git://github.com/tonysimpson/nanomsg-python.git fi cd $_pwd } install_nanomsg

remove python 2.6 trove classifier

remove the trove classifier implying that this project supports 2.6.

subject: Remove some useless configuration command
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-15 11:13:13.000000000', 'files': ['doc/install-guide/source/neutron-compute-install.rst'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals/commit/76e5f6859b1e99fffe39f917f253da0a5ac67912', 'message': "Remove some useless configuration command

A symbolic link which is /etc/neutron/plugin.ini pointing to
/etc/neutron/plugins/ml2/ml2_conf.ini is told to create when
we install and configure the networking service in the
compute node.
But it's no need to be created, because there is no
'/etc/neutron/plugins/ml2/ml2_conf.ini' file and
the ML2 plug-in is installed in the controller node.
Thus we should remove this command and skip this step.
Backport: Liberty

Change-Id: I76feb15477ffd2d65cc8eb46c7472b6de830105f
Close-bug: #1525075
"}]
commit_message:
Remove some useless configuration command

A symbolic link which is /etc/neutron/plugin.ini pointing to
/etc/neutron/plugins/ml2/ml2_conf.ini is told to create when
we install and configure the networking service in the
compute node.
But it's no need to be created, because there is no
'/etc/neutron/plugins/ml2/ml2_conf.ini' file and
the ML2 plug-in is installed in the controller node.
Thus we should remove this command and skip this step.
Backport: Liberty

Change-Id: I76feb15477ffd2d65cc8eb46c7472b6de830105f
Close-bug: #1525075
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/34/257834/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

The Networking service initialization scripts expect a symbolic link ``/etc/neutron/plugin.ini`` pointing to the ML2 plug-in configuration file, ``/etc/neutron/plugins/ml2/ml2_conf.ini``. If this symbolic link does not exist, create it using the following command: .. code-block:: console # ln -s /etc/neutron/plugins/ml2/ml2_conf.ini /etc/neutron/plugin.ini

commit_message:
Add hypervisor, aggregates, migration description

Add hypervisor brief description on its concept and
how nova offer the ability to admin to interact with it;
Also add description for migraitons.
There is a doc about aggregates, so put the link
in general_info.rst.

blueprint complete-todo-in-api-concept-doc

Change-Id: I61f6999be62e3e689ca9bf8b28b08f6a0b4aa9df
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/37/250737/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: A hypervisor or virtual machine monitor (VMM) is a piece of computer software, firmware or hardware that creates and runs virtual machines. In nova, A hypervisor is located in one Host(see `Hosts`), admin is able to query information on the hypervisor such as all the virtual servers on the hypervisor, the detailed info of the hypervisor such as cpu, memory, disk etc related configuration. Please see :doc:`aggregates` (nova/doc/source/aggregates.rst)

subject: update create_heat_accounts, don't use os_url and os_token
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-20 06:29:54.000000000', 'files': ['functions-common', 'lib/heat'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack/commit/4ce859ab2b99e68ce937c9c9df83d9270c8ef9fb', 'message': 'update create_heat_accounts, don't use os_url and os_token

Currently, the function create_heat_accounts uses the OS_URL and
OS_TOKEN environment variables. This is a bad choice for several
reasons, most importantly we are sending the "ADMIN_TOKEN" value
as a header. There is also no reason to not use a standard admin

Change-Id: I70b41d69917b9e53ad09c2c61e022ef09a50acfd
'}]
commit_message:
update create_heat_accounts, don't use os_url and os_token

Currently, the function create_heat_accounts uses the OS_URL and
OS_TOKEN environment variables. This is a bad choice for several
reasons, most importantly we are sending the "ADMIN_TOKEN" value
as a header. There is also no reason to not use a standard admin
user to create these resources.

Change-Id: I70b41d69917b9e53ad09c2c61e022ef09a50acfd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/39/259739/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # domain -> heat and user -> heat_domain_admin domain_id=$(get_or_create_domain heat 'Owns users and projects created by heat') iniset $HEAT_CONF DEFAULT stack_user_domain_id ${domain_id} get_or_create_user heat_domain_admin $SERVICE_PASSWORD heat get_or_add_user_domain_role admin heat_domain_admin heat iniset $HEAT_CONF DEFAULT stack_domain_admin heat_domain_admin iniset $HEAT_CONF DEFAULT stack_domain_admin_password $SERVICE_PASSWORD
deleted_lines: # Note we have to pass token/endpoint here because the current endpoint and # version negotiation in OSC means just --os-identity-api-version=3 won't work D_ID=$(openstack --os-token $OS_TOKEN --os-url=$KEYSTONE_SERVICE_URI_V3 \ --os-identity-api-version=3 domain list | grep ' heat ' | get_field 1) if [[ -z "$D_ID" ]]; then D_ID=$(openstack --os-token $OS_TOKEN --os-url=$KEYSTONE_SERVICE_URI_V3 \ --os-identity-api-version=3 domain create heat \ --description "Owns users and projects created by heat" \ | grep ' id ' | get_field 2) iniset $HEAT_CONF DEFAULT stack_user_domain_id ${D_ID} openstack --os-token $OS_TOKEN --os-url=$KEYSTONE_SERVICE_URI_V3 \ --os-identity-api-version=3 user create --password $SERVICE_PASSWORD \ --domain $D_ID heat_domain_admin \ --description "Manages users and projects created by heat" openstack --os-token $OS_TOKEN --os-url=$KEYSTONE_SERVICE_URI_V3 \ --os-identity-api-version=3 role add \ --user heat_domain_admin --domain ${D_ID} admin iniset $HEAT_CONF DEFAULT stack_domain_admin heat_domain_admin iniset $HEAT_CONF DEFAULT stack_domain_admin_password $SERVICE_PASSWORD fi

commit_message:
fix the clone script for the updated gerrit

gerrit now includes All-Users as one of the projects in the ls-projects
output, but that doesn't seem to be a real project so filter only on
things that actually have "openstack" at the start of the name.

Change-Id: I1c1281a5e502dd40f770c7d6ce4b06604c680137

commit_message:
Fix README.rst, add a check for it to fit PyPI rules

README.rst doesn't appear right on PyPI currently. This commit fixes the
issue and expands "docs" environment in tox.ini to use readme tool [0]
to verify that README.rst is good for PyPI.

[0] https://github.com/pypa/readme

Change-Id: I6025bb6c661d8a4a7cd9802a1298928662278f2d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/os-client-config refs/changes/76/262776/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: deps = {[testenv]deps} readme commands = python setup.py build_sphinx python setup.py check -r -s

announcements should go concluded that announcements about library
releases should go to openstack-dev instead of openstack-announce [1].
Since most of our releases are for libraries, change the default for the
announcement. We will have more work to do to update the announcement

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-December/082171.html

Change-Id: I777f8ab7eafd661932655d5e67de3c494caa110f

commit_message:
start sending release announcements to openstack-dev by default

The Nov/Dec 2015 mailing list thread discussing where release
announcements should go concluded that announcements about library
releases should go to openstack-dev instead of openstack-announce [1].
Since most of our releases are for libraries, change the default for the
announcement. We will have more work to do to update the announcement
script to set an appropriate "to address" based on the deliverable type.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-December/082171.html

Change-Id: I777f8ab7eafd661932655d5e67de3c494caa110f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/release-tools refs/changes/89/260989/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: default="openstack-dev@lists.openstack.org",

commit_message:
Put py34 first in the env order of tox

To solve the problem of "db type could
not be determined" on py34 we have to run first the py34 env to, then, run
py27. This patch puts py34 first on the tox.ini list of envs to avoid this
problem to happen.

Change-Id: I06c6a276b75eb2a3d69e94f467f26122d856d17c
Closes-bug: #1489059
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-novaclient refs/changes/99/260499/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: envlist = py34,py27,pypy,pep8,docs

commit_message:
Fix extension loading from python path on Python 2.7

Commit 81f8fa655ccecd409fe6dcda0d3763592c053e57 broke extension loading
from pythonpath on python 2.7 due to the removal of code that was
erroneously marked for 2.6 compatibility. Put it back.

Change-Id: Ic04f4d57953967fde9817ff5119ce0182453a86d
Closes-Bug: #1530230

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-07 00:35:49.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneclient/tests/functional/v3/__init__.py', 'keystoneclient/tests/functional/v2_0/__init__.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-keystoneclient/commit/de242990551e5f094692c691aeb88ff21ddb0d34', 'message': 'Initialize /v2_0 and /v3 functional tests dirs

In the cross project workshop "Establishing key themes for the Mitaka
cycle" [1] during the Mitaka summit, one of the agreed point was to
implement functional tests for the client libraries. [2]

Later on, this will serve to improve our backward compatibility for
client libraries. See I72e4e9cfa0539f6b326a0296c065fa3cb754f8ae

This commit initializes the directories for creating functional tests
for both v2_0 and v3 versions of the client.

[1] https://mitakadesignsummit.sched.org/event/edd78ade4c7c92581a7cabc26019a85a
[2] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/mitaka-crossproject-themes

Change-Id: Id98662db8e8551519770238c85f146118c0bfd09
'}]
commit_message:
Initialize /v2_0 and /v3 functional tests dirs

In the cross project workshop "Establishing key themes for the Mitaka
cycle" [1] during the Mitaka summit, one of the agreed point was to
implement functional tests for the client libraries. [2]

Later on, this will serve to improve our backward compatibility for
client libraries. See I72e4e9cfa0539f6b326a0296c065fa3cb754f8ae

This commit initializes the directories for creating functional tests
for both v2_0 and v3 versions of the client.

[1] https://mitakadesignsummit.sched.org/event/edd78ade4c7c92581a7cabc26019a85a
[2] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/mitaka-crossproject-themes

Change-Id: Id98662db8e8551519770238c85f146118c0bfd09

subject: Wrong usage of "a/an"
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-30 01:10:58.000000000', 'files': ['novaclient/v2/shell.py', 'novaclient/exceptions.py', 'novaclient/v2/servers.py', 'novaclient/v2/contrib/instance_action.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-novaclient/commit/2283b46a2f63b9fdb5c3c20a1ddfbba4c37d858e', 'message': 'Wrong usage of "a/an"

Wrong usage of "a/an" in the messages:
"It will be deprecated after an suitable deprecation"
"Delete metadata from an server"
"Get a list of actions performed on an server"
"based on an requests response"
"Get a aggregate by name or ID"

Should be:
"It will be deprecated after a suitable deprecation"
"Delete metadata from a server"
"Get a list of actions performed on a server"
"based on a requests response"
"Get an aggregate by name or ID"

Totally 5 occurrences in python-novaclient base code.

'}]
commit_message:
Wrong usage of "a/an"

Wrong usage of "a/an" in the messages:
"It will be deprecated after an suitable deprecation"
"Delete metadata from an server"
"Get a list of actions performed on an server"
"based on an requests response"
"Get a aggregate by name or ID"

Should be:
"It will be deprecated after a suitable deprecation"
"Delete metadata from a server"
"Get a list of actions performed on a server"
"based on a requests response"
"Get an aggregate by name or ID"

Totally 5 occurrences in python-novaclient base code.

Change-Id: Iabe764f8b547b39431deb34221266695e0e79fa9

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-27 21:26:45.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-novaclient/commit/c49490ca96174933a3135eee965c4f94aa0fdee9', 'message': 'Fix help strings

Reviewing the import of novaclient 3.1.0 into the CLI Reference (change
Ib39cdfdd563a2a53f0e6de1f8d2dc4f8c4678c15), a few inconsistencies where
found and fixed:
* Missing "." at end of help string
* Inconsistent capitalization of "DEPRECATED, use"
* Inconsistent capitalization of "Set or delete"
* It's IPv4 and IPv6

commit_message:
Fix help strings

Reviewing the import of novaclient 3.1.0 into the CLI Reference (change
Ib39cdfdd563a2a53f0e6de1f8d2dc4f8c4678c15), a few inconsistencies where
found and fixed:
* Missing "." at end of help string
* Inconsistent capitalization of "DEPRECATED, use"
* Inconsistent capitalization of "Set or delete"
* It's IPv4 and IPv6
* It's ID

Change-Id: I425cd6575ca31efd92fc7f0be6192031886fcc41

To solve the problem of "db type could not be determined" on py34
we have to run first the py34 env to, then, run py27. This patch

Closes-bug: #1489059

commit_message:
Put py34 first in the env order of tox

To solve the problem of "db type could not be determined" on py34
we have to run first the py34 env to, then, run py27. This patch
puts py34 first on the tox.ini list of envs to avoid this problem
to happen.

Change-Id: Iabc31bfa508fbf4fad19bd0f09f389a8d3f52865
Closes-bug: #1489059
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/zaqar refs/changes/21/254121/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: envlist = py34,py27,pypy,pep8

commit_message:
Cleanup needless code from oslo-incubator

oslo-incubator was deprecated and all modules used by novaclient were
removed from oslo-incubator master branch. This patch removes all unused
code from novaclient's repo.

Change-Id: Ie3c542d19da6ed4d25ec490faf6a86a82f48cd34
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-novaclient refs/changes/44/259044/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: # Copyright 2013 OpenStack Foundation # Copyright 2013 Spanish National Research Council. # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. # E0202: An attribute inherited from %s hide this method # pylint: disable=E0202 ######################################################################## # # THIS MODULE IS DEPRECATED # # Please refer to # https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/kilo-novaclient-library-proposals for # the discussion leading to this deprecation. # # We recommend checking out the python-openstacksdk project # (https://launchpad.net/python-openstacksdk) instead. # ######################################################################## import abc import argparse import os import six from stevedore import extension from novaclient.openstack.common.apiclient import exceptions _discovered_plugins = {} def discover_auth_systems(): """Discover the available auth-systems. This won't take into account the old style auth-systems. """ global _discovered_plugins _discovered_plugins = {} def add_plugin(ext): _discovered_plugins[ext.name] = ext.plugin ep_namespace = "novaclient.openstack.common.apiclient.auth" mgr = extension.ExtensionManager(ep_namespace) mgr.map(add_plugin) def load_auth_system_opts(parser): """Load options needed by the available auth-systems into a parser. This function will try to populate the parser with options from the available plugins. """ group = parser.add_argument_group("Common auth options") BaseAuthPlugin.add_common_opts(group) for name, auth_plugin in six.iteritems(_discovered_plugins): group = parser.add_argument_group( "Auth-system '%s' options" % name, conflict_handler="resolve") auth_plugin.add_opts(group) def load_plugin(auth_system): try: plugin_class = _discovered_plugins[auth_system] except KeyError: raise exceptions.AuthSystemNotFound(auth_system) return plugin_class(auth_system=auth_system) def load_plugin_from_args(args): """Load required plugin and populate it with options. Try to guess auth system if it is not specified. Systems are tried in alphabetical order. :type args: argparse.Namespace :raises: AuthPluginOptionsMissing """ auth_system = args.os_auth_system if auth_system: plugin = load_plugin(auth_system) plugin.parse_opts(args) plugin.sufficient_options() return plugin for plugin_auth_system in sorted(six.iterkeys(_discovered_plugins)): plugin_class = _discovered_plugins[plugin_auth_system] plugin = plugin_class() plugin.parse_opts(args) try: plugin.sufficient_options() except exceptions.AuthPluginOptionsMissing: continue return plugin raise exceptions.AuthPluginOptionsMissing(["auth_system"]) @six.add_metaclass(abc.ABCMeta) class BaseAuthPlugin(object): """Base class for authentication plugins. An authentication plugin needs to override at least the authenticate method to be a valid plugin. """ auth_system = None opt_names = [] common_opt_names = [ "auth_system", "username", "password", "tenant_name", "token", "auth_url", ] def __init__(self, auth_system=None, **kwargs): self.auth_system = auth_system or self.auth_system self.opts = dict((name, kwargs.get(name)) for name in self.opt_names) @staticmethod def _parser_add_opt(parser, opt): """Add an option to parser in two variants. :param opt: option name (with underscores) """ dashed_opt = opt.replace("_", "-") env_var = "OS_%s" % opt.upper() arg_default = os.environ.get(env_var, "") arg_help = "Defaults to env[%s]." % env_var parser.add_argument( "--os-%s" % dashed_opt, metavar="<%s>" % dashed_opt, default=arg_default, help=arg_help) parser.add_argument( "--os_%s" % opt, metavar="<%s>" % dashed_opt, help=argparse.SUPPRESS) @classmethod def add_opts(cls, parser): """Populate the parser with the options for this plugin. """ for opt in cls.opt_names: # use `BaseAuthPlugin.common_opt_names` since it is never # changed in child classes if opt not in BaseAuthPlugin.common_opt_names: cls._parser_add_opt(parser, opt) @classmethod def add_common_opts(cls, parser): """Add options that are common for several plugins. """ for opt in cls.common_opt_names: cls._parser_add_opt(parser, opt) @staticmethod def get_opt(opt_name, args): """Return option name and value. :param opt_name: name of the option, e.g., "username" :param args: parsed arguments """ return (opt_name, getattr(args, "os_%s" % opt_name, None)) def parse_opts(self, args): """Parse the actual auth-system options if any. This method is expected to populate the attribute `self.opts` with a dict containing the options and values needed to make authentication. """ self.opts.update(dict(self.get_opt(opt_name, args) for opt_name in self.opt_names)) def authenticate(self, http_client): """Authenticate using plugin defined method. The method usually analyses `self.opts` and performs a request to authentication server. :param http_client: client object that needs authentication :type http_client: HTTPClient :raises: AuthorizationFailure """ self.sufficient_options() self._do_authenticate(http_client) @abc.abstractmethod def _do_authenticate(self, http_client): """Protected method for authentication. """ def sufficient_options(self): """Check if all required options are present. :raises: AuthPluginOptionsMissing """ missing = [opt for opt in self.opt_names if not self.opts.get(opt)] if missing: raise exceptions.AuthPluginOptionsMissing(missing) @abc.abstractmethod def token_and_endpoint(self, endpoint_type, service_type): """Return token and endpoint. :param service_type: Service type of the endpoint :type service_type: string :param endpoint_type: Type of endpoint. Possible values: public or publicURL, internal or internalURL, admin or adminURL :type endpoint_type: string :returns: tuple of token and endpoint strings :raises: EndpointException """

Replace assertEqual(None, *) with assertIsNone in tests

Replace assertEqual(None, *) with assertIsNone in tests to have
more clear messages in case of failure.

commit_message:
Kill neutron-rootwrap-daemon when stop neutron service

Neutron-rootwrap-daemon cannot be killed when you stop
neutron services, so here we add the right command in
the neutron stop-service scripts.

Change-Id: I91fefb277427e0e16ff59760b7255e4c7eee1792
Closes-Bug: #1525601
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/98/256998/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: sudo pkill -9 -f neutron-rootwrap-daemon || :

commit_message:
Enable swap stats in dstat

Swap stats could be useful for trouble-shooting. It is better to
have it enabled in dstat.

Change-Id: I44e0735a95cd6ca3def9b04510551df16a1337a4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/16/259816/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

otherwise default to relying on it already being installed

commit_message:
Move storage strategy code from guestagent to common

To properly support different storage strategies the taskmanager
needs to be able to access the proper storage strategy to determine
things like the container name.

The patch addresses moving the storage strategy from guestagent
to common.

Change-Id: If81100cc88c6b883492c9f7b1a5e2437ba155eda
Closes-Bug: 1525283

commit_message:
Add option to skip EPEL & other repo installs

Add an option to skip the EPEL & other repo installs for rhel7 based
platforms.

This option can serve two purposes; firstly as described in
I834f20e9ceae151788cec3649385da1274d7ba46 during platform bringup, a
publically available EPEL might not be available.  This will allow you
to pre-configure a hand-built repo, etc. so you can continue testing.

The other thing is that in a CI system you might be frequently
building images and pre-installing EPEL/RDO etc.  In that case this is
just extra work.

Change-Id: I9809449f4a43fa9b547c6e3ca92722c7f6e66d6a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/25/244425/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Change LOG.warn to LOG.warning

Python 3 deprecated the logger.warn method, see:
https://docs.python.org/3/library/logging.html#logging.warning
so we prefer to use warning to avoid DeprecationWarning.

Change-Id: Ie27b28d44bb3a9cb78d43c947d51f53d494fa827
Closes-Bug: #1530742

commit_message:
Require a keystone v3 endpoint for project quota lookup

When keystoneclient selects the v2 endpoint, the quota-show
command fails with

          raise AttributeError(_("Unknown Attribute: %s") % name)
on

    project = keystone.projects.get(id, subtree_as_ids=subtree_as_ids)

Closes-Bug: 1517043

Change-Id: I89443b6de5b1d70cdcff31fe01719a8cc9878fa5

commit_message:
Split out Neutron subnetpools client

Splitting out a subnetpools client for Neutron.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: Id968946d174779e0b3bab88f9de93dfc66d79209
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/24/257724/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2015 NEC Corporation. All rights reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from tempest.services.network.json import base class SubnetpoolsClient(base.BaseNetworkClient): def list_subnetpools(self, **filters): uri = '/subnetpools' return self.list_resources(uri, **filters) def create_subnetpools(self, **kwargs): uri = '/subnetpools' post_data = {'subnetpool': kwargs} return self.create_resource(uri, post_data) def show_subnetpools(self, subnetpool_id, **fields): uri = '/subnetpools/%s' % subnetpool_id return self.show_resource(uri, **fields) def update_subnetpools(self, subnetpool_id, **kwargs): uri = '/subnetpools/%s' % subnetpool_id post_data = {'subnetpool': kwargs} return self.update_resource(uri, post_data) def delete_subnetpools(self, subnetpool_id): uri = '/subnetpools/%s' % subnetpool_id return self.delete_resource(uri)

commit_message:
Use new log style when LOG.error

Use new log style where Logger.exception() is used by passing an
exception object as the argument[1].

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.log/usage.html
Closes-Bug: #1529534

Change-Id: I16f78e7c4b0b656b78339758bae2a6d1dcd43a3d

commit_message:
Init local request context with user/project domain infos

Set user/project domain id/name from req.headers while
init local request context. Then we can use them if needed.

Change-Id: I95e937e226e308517485641189c667502529b85e

commit_message:
Added separate HEADS files.

As per the latest alembic migration rules separate
expand and contract HEAD files are required.

In addition to this I have renamed the liberty migration folder
to Mitaka as 'networking-sfc' project can only be released with
mitaka now as liberty time-frame has already passed.

Change-Id: Iec2a8b4120296a31ec204455f67cfa9e11ec6b15

commit_message:
Change LOG.warn to LOG.warning

Python 3 deprecated the logger.warn method, see:
https://docs.python.org/3/library/logging.html#logging.warning
so we prefer to use warning to avoid DeprecationWarning.

Partial-Bug: #1530742
Change-Id: I6e680ad30dc48132b2bf52a87e164ae330faef0c

commit_message:
Drop py26 support

as of mitaka, the infra team won't have the resources available to
reasonably test py26, also the oslo team is dropping py26 support
from their libraries. sine we rely on oslo for a lot of our work,

Change-Id: I352fe202a1f954b52e8e9ef8bc0a20f729ac17be

commit_message:
Revert "Revert "Remove argparse workaround (ostf)""

This reverts commit 299cadd5347a550a15524e385154593f969db4c9.

Fixes to python-muranoclient and python-saharaclient were merged, so there are no dependencies for argparse.

Change-Id: Ia529ce6b5ef9e348d0957b254f185b483a5f9ca5
Closes-bug: #1524714

subject: Add round-trip encrypter/decrypter unit tests
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-01 01:45:15.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/37d6a03644ed31bed7ebf0e089fa2c524e769cf2', 'message': 'Add round-trip encrypter/decrypter unit tests

The current encrypter/decrypter unit tests are separate; thus encryption and decryption are tested in isolation. This is good practice, however it results in the decrypter being tested by fake/generated encrypted data and thus there is a risk that this fake data diverges from the reality of what the encrypter writes.

These quasi-unit-tests are intended to test a full round-trip encrypt->decrypt cycle. More information can be found here:
https://trello.com/c/PzGrFutj/64-back-to-back-unit-tests-for-encrypter-decrypter

Change-Id: Id08d92e24c818fcaf20c750b4dd7ca317394a6fb
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-12-01 01:47:05.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/d2de596024de5665ad049758ab8c063e49d46027', 'message': 'Add round-trip encrypter/decrypter unit tests

The current encrypter/decrypter unit tests are separate; thus
encryption and decryption are tested in isolation. This is good
practice, however it results in the decrypter being tested by
fake/generated encrypted data and thus there is a risk that this fake
data diverges from the reality of what the encrypter writes.

These quasi-unit-tests are intended to test a full round-trip
encrypt->decrypt cycle. More information can be found here:
https://trello.com/c/PzGrFutj/64-back-to-back-unit-tests-for-encrypter-decrypter

Change-Id: Id08d92e24c818fcaf20c750b4dd7ca317394a6fb

commit_message:
Add round-trip encrypter/decrypter unit tests

The current encrypter/decrypter unit tests are separate; thus
encryption and decryption are tested in isolation. This is good
practice, however it results in the decrypter being tested by
fake/generated encrypted data and thus there is a risk that this fake
data diverges from the reality of what the encrypter writes.

These quasi-unit-tests are intended to test a full round-trip
encrypt->decrypt cycle. The real Crypto implementation is used instead
of a FakeCrypto mock/stub.

The FakeSwift test harness has also been fixed to support these tests.

More information can be found here:
https://trello.com/c/PzGrFutj/64-back-to-back-unit-tests-for-encrypter-decrypter

Change-Id: Id08d92e24c818fcaf20c750b4dd7ca317394a6fb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/06/251606/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright (c) 2015 OpenStack Foundation # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. # You may obtain a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or # implied. # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and # limitations under the License. import unittest import mock from swift.common.middleware import encrypter, decrypter from swift.common.swob import Request, HTTPCreated, HTTPOk from test.unit.common.middleware.crypto_helpers import fetch_crypto_keys, \ md5hex, FakeCrypto from test.unit.common.middleware.helpers import FakeSwift @mock.patch('swift.common.middleware.encrypter.Crypto', FakeCrypto) @mock.patch('swift.common.middleware.decrypter.Crypto', FakeCrypto) class TestEncrypterDecrypter(unittest.TestCase): """ Unit tests to verify round-trip encryption followed by decryption. These tests serve to compliment the separate unit tests for encrypter and decrypter, which are also tested in isolation. """ def test_basic_put_get_req(self): # Setup pass the PUT request through the encrypter. body = 'FAKE APP' env = {'REQUEST_METHOD': 'PUT', 'swift.crypto.fetch_crypto_keys': fetch_crypto_keys} hdrs = {'content-type': 'text/plain', 'content-length': str(len(body)), 'x-object-meta-test': 'encrypt me', 'x-object-sysmeta-test': 'do not encrypt me'} req = Request.blank( '/v1/a/c/o', environ=env, body=body, headers=hdrs) encrypt_app = FakeSwift() encrypt_app.register('PUT', '/v1/a/c/o', HTTPCreated, {}) req.get_response(encrypter.Encrypter(encrypt_app, {})) # Encrypted headers captured from FakeSwift. encrypt_req_hdrs = encrypt_app.headers[0] # Obtain the encrypted response body. encrypt_get_req = Request.blank('/v1/a/c/o', environ={'REQUEST_METHOD': 'GET'}) encrypt_get_resp = encrypt_get_req.get_response(encrypt_app) # Call the decrypter using the output from the encrypter: # - Body is from a GET request to the FakeSwift following the PUT # using encryption. # - Headers are from the output/transformed request headers of the # PUT, by inspecting FakeSwift.headers[0] following the PUT. decrypt_env = {'REQUEST_METHOD': 'GET', 'swift.crypto.fetch_crypto_keys': fetch_crypto_keys} decrypt_req = Request.blank('/v1/a/c/o', environ=decrypt_env) decrypt_app = FakeSwift() decrypt_app.register('GET', '/v1/a/c/o', HTTPOk, body=encrypt_get_resp.body, headers=encrypt_req_hdrs) decrypt_resp = decrypt_req.get_response( decrypter.Decrypter(decrypt_app, {})) self.assertEqual(body, decrypt_resp.body) self.assertEqual('200 OK', decrypt_resp.status) self.assertEqual('text/plain', decrypt_resp.headers['Content-Type']) self.assertEqual(md5hex(body), decrypt_resp.headers['Etag']) self.assertEqual('encrypt me', decrypt_resp.headers['x-object-meta-test']) self.assertEqual('do not encrypt me', decrypt_resp.headers['x-object-sysmeta-test']) if __name__ == '__main__': unittest.main()
